intro: Dodecatheon meadia var. frenchii, commonly known as the French poppy, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, nodding flowers that range in color from white to pink, with a distinctive, cup-shaped corolla. The plant typically grows to a height of 12–24 inches and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
